item.title: ZERO PARADES: For Dead Spies limited-time demo for PC launches February 23
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Play through a tailored version of the game's opening.

ZA/UM will release a limited-time demo for espionage RPG ZERO PARADES: For Dead Spies as part of Steam Next Fest: February 2026 Edition from February 23 to March 16, the developer announced.

The demo will allow players to step into the shoes of Hershel Wilk, the game’s “brilliant but tormented operant,” and explore the city-state of Portofiro in a tailored version of the game’s opening featuring two quests and various side stories.

ZERO PARADES: For Dead Spies is due out for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam in 2026.

Watch a new trailer below.

Steam Next Fest: February 2026 Edition Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/zero-parades-for-dead-spies-limited-time-demo-for-pc-launches-february-23
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Crimson Desert ‘Features Overview #3: Life in Pywel’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

A look at some of the things that shape your day-to-day life.

Pearl Abyss has released a new featurette for open-world action adventure game Crimson Desert introducing the day-to-day life in the world of Pywel.

Here are the latest details:

Previous videos highlighted the game’s narrative, regions, exploration, quests, open-world design, combat system and progression mechanics. The newly released video focuses on the world of Pywel and the activities that players can choose to partake in.

The video introduces content available throughout Pywel, designed to support players’ adventures by providing essential resources. Players can fish and hunt to gather cooking ingredients, collect flowers and insects for use in alchemy, and obtain materials for crafting and equipment enhancement through gathering and mining.

Also featured is the Greymane Camp in Hernand, a settlement established by Kliff and his Greymane companions after losing their home to the Black Bears faction, following a vicious attack. Using resources and currency earned through exploration, players can expand the camp’s functionality and turn it into an important foothold in the players’ journey.

Within the camp, players can manage farms and ranch to produce cooking and crafting materials, purchase supplies from a camp vendor, and dispatch reunited companions on missions to acquire resources such as timber, ore, and more. These systems allow players to actively shape the camp’s growth. The preview also highlights character customization options. Players can customize the characters’ appearance using dyes found throughout Pywel or crafted through alchemy, adjusting outfits, hairstyles, and tattoos to match individual preferences.

Cities and villages across the Pywel continent are depicted as being populated by blacksmiths, tailors, merchants, and residents in need of assistance. These NPCs will react to player’s harmful actions, become hostile or issue bounties depending on behavior, bringing another element to interaction with NPCs within the world. Pearl Abyss announced earlier this month via its official social media channels that Crimson Desert has surpassed two million wishlists worldwide.

Crimson Desert is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on March 19.

Watch the video below.

Features Overview #3: Life in Pywel



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/crimson-desert-features-overview-3-life-in-pywel-trailer
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Famitsu Sales: 2/2/26 – 2/8/26
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Dragon Quest VII Reimagined debuts at 456,552 retail copies sold.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for the week of February 2, 2026 to February 8, 2026.

Dragon Quest VII Reimagined was the highest selling new release of the week, opening at 177,653 units on Switch, 160,101 units on Switch 2, and 118,798 units on PlayStation 5 for an opening week total of 456,552 retail copies sold.

Also new, Nioh 3 for PlayStation 5 debuted at 40,570 retail copies sold.

On the hardware side, Switch 2 sold 65,807 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 11,130 units, the Switch family sold 8,892 units, the Xbox Series family sold 1,253 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 22 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [NSW] Dragon Quest VII Reimagined (Square Enix, 02/05/26) – 177,653 (New)
  2. [SW2] Dragon Quest VII Reimagined (Square Enix, 02/05/26) – 160,101 (New)

item.title: WorldNeverland: Daily Life in the Elnea Kingdom coming to Xbox Series on February 26
item.content:encoded:
• Xbox Series

The life simulation game by althi.

althi will release life simulation game WorldNeverland: Daily Life in the Elnea Kingdom for Xbox Series and PC via Microsoft Store on February 26, the developer announced. It will also support Xbox Play Anyhwere.

WorldNeverland: Daily Life in the Elnea Kingdom first launched for Android on May 26, 2015, followed by iOS on August 4, 2015, Switch on March 15, 2018, and PC via Steam on January 15, 2025. It has been downloaded over 2.5 million times.

The game will be available in the following editions:

  • Standard Edition ($29.99)
    • A copy of the game
  • Deluxe Edition ($45.99)
    • A copy of the game
    • Downloadable content
      • “Challenge Dungeons”
      • Exclusive “Fresh Green Attire”

The following downloadable content will also be available at launch:

  • “Challenge Dungeons” ($15.99)
  • “Wedding Attire” ($9.99)
  • “Handcraft Tools Set” ($4.99)
  • “Monster Event Set” ($9.99)

Here is an overview of the game, via althi:

About

Spin your own life—an endless sandbox life simulation.

What if you could freely choose another life? WorldNeverland: Daily Life in the Elnea Kingdom is a sandbox life simulation game where you can move to a fictional kingdom you’ve always dreamed of and enjoy a carefree life. Why not weave a grand story spanning generations with your own hands?

The Allure of This Game

The latest installment in the WorldNeverland (affectionately known as “Waruneba“) series, this game is the first to feature full 3D graphics. Its greatest strength is the ability to play endlessly through succession play, which even includes the inheritance of character appearances.

This vibrant kingdom, existing within your computer, features beautiful forests and rivers, vast farms, bustling ranches, deep mines, as well as schools, churches, and royal castles—every imaginable place exists. The lives of its many inhabitants are intricately simulated, allowing you to enjoy realistic interactions as if you were playing an MMORPG.

Life in this country is infinitely varied, depending on your choices. Find a lover, eventually marry, have children, and pass on your legacy to descendants… Each playthrough creates a unique, one-of-a-kind story just for you. This experience goes beyond typical gaming, surely leaving a cherished memory in your heart forever.

A Free Life in Elnea Kingdom

You’ll arrive in this kingdom as a traveler, eventually become a citizen, and can live your ideal life.

  • Build a Home and Accumulate Assets – Own your own house and farm, save money, and even move into a lavish mansion.
  • Participate in Kingdom Events – Join seasonal events, national ceremonies, festivals, weddings, births, and funerals as both a main character and a guest.
  • Love and Marriage – Befriend unmarried individuals, fall in love, and eventually marry.
  • Forge a Career – Work hard in your chosen profession or martial arts, improve your standing in the kingdom, and aim for promotion.
  • Family Prosperity – Have many children and expand your descendants, building your own unique family lineage.
  • Long-Term Play Across Generations – Pass on your game to your children, experiencing a grand story that spans multiple generations.
  • Cooking and Exploration – Create various dishes from different ingredients, or explore dungeons and forests to defeat monsters and gather materials for cooking and weaponry.
  • Become the Kingdom’s Best Warrior – Enter martial arts tournaments and aim for the title of the kingdom’s strongest hero.
  • Explore History – The kingdom boasts hundreds of years of rich history, which you can leisurely delve into at the library.
  • Endless Choices – To do something or not to do something, everything is entirely up to you, the player.

Watch a new trailer below.

Xbox Series Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/02/worldneverland-daily-life-in-the-elnea-kingdom-coming-to-xbox-series-on-february-26
